§ 6953. Healthy food financing initiative(a) PurposeThe purpose of this section is to enhance the authorities of the Secretary to support efforts to provide access to healthy food by establishing an initiative to improve access to healthy foods in underserved areas, to create and preserve quality jobs, and to revitalize low-income communities by providing loans and grants to eligible fresh, healthy food retailers and enterprises to overcome the higher costs and initial barriers to entry in underserved areas.
(b) DefinitionsIn this section:(1) Community development financial institutionThe term “community development financial institution” has the meaning given the term in section 4702 of title 12.
(2) InitiativeThe term “Initiative” means the Healthy Food Financing Initiative established under subsection (c)(1).
(3) National fund managerThe term “national fund manager” means a community development financial institution that is—(A) in existence on the date of enactment of this section; and
(B) certified by the Community Development Financial Institution Fund of the Department of Treasury to manage the Initiative for purposes of—(i) raising private capital;
(ii) providing financial and technical assistance to partnerships; and
(iii) funding eligible projects to attract fresh, healthy food retailers and enterprises to underserved areas, in accordance with this section.
(4) PartnershipThe term “partnership” means a regional, State, or local public-private partnership that—(A) is organized to improve access to fresh, healthy foods;
(B) provides financial and technical assistance to eligible projects; and
(C) meets such other criteria as the Secretary may establish.
(5) Perishable foodThe term “perishable food” means a staple food that is fresh, refrigerated, or frozen.
